documents.title: Comprehensive SPCA Issues Report
documents.author: Kashish Kumar
documents.description: Detailed report submitted in November 2024 cataloging persistent issues at SPCA Chandigarh despite some improvements in cleanliness and organization.
keyPoints: Failure to protect visitors and volunteers from harassment
Gross discipline failure during Diwali night (October 31, 2024)
Lack of complaint redressal system
Pending structural repairs and ambulance procurement
Ongoing issues with essential supplies procurement
Lack of supervision during evening shifts

documents.title: Animal Mortality RTI Response
documents.author: SPCA Chandigarh
documents.description: Official RTI response revealing that 47% of animals (6,383 out of 13,567) brought to the shelter between January 2019 and September 2021 died during treatment.
keyPoints: 47% overall mortality rate from January 2019 to September 2021
73% of deaths were street dogs (4,665 animals)
2,315 deaths during a nine-month period in 2021 alone
Month-by-month breakdown of mortality statistics
No explanation provided for high death rates

documents.title: Punjab and Haryana HC Order on Visiting Hours
documents.author: Punjab and Haryana High Court
documents.description: High Court order directing the Chandigarh administration to restore earlier visiting hours for animal lovers after determining that restrictive timings were hampering animal welfare.
keyPoints: Court recognition of animal lovers' right to participate in welfare
Directive to return to previous visiting hour schedule
Acknowledgment of volunteer contribution to animal care
Requirement for administration to hear volunteers before making policy changes
Precedent set for public participation in animal welfare facilities

documents.title: High Court Order on SPCA Facility Discrepancies

keyPoints: Identification of serious operational deficiencies by court-appointed commissioners
15-day deadline imposed for rectification
Threat of penalties for non-compliance
Direction to implement proper animal welfare standards
Court monitoring of compliance with animal welfare laws

issues.title: Leadership and Accountability Gaps
issues.description: Inconsistent leadership with frequent changes in administration has severely impacted continuity and implementation of reforms.
details: MC Commissioner Anindita Mitra's term ended August 2024
Responsibility temporarily assigned to DC Chandigarh
Honorary General Secretary (MOH) retired
Lack of continuity in policy implementation
Stalled progress on approved initiatives
Confusion regarding responsibility and accountability
Absence of regular monitoring meetings previously agreed upon

issues.title: Staff Conduct Problems
issues.description: Numerous instances of staff misconduct, particularly toward visitors and volunteers, with limited accountability.
details: Harassment of female volunteers and senior citizens
Verbal targeting of visitors who report issues
Staff absenteeism during critical times (Diwali incident)
Reports of staff demanding excessive payments for medicines (Rs. 500 for Rs. 25 injection)
Doctors socializing during duty hours, making patients wait
Reports of doctors' quarters being used inappropriately
Doctors maintaining private practices creating conflicts of interest
Concerning conduct of Dr. Vikram, arriving only at 5:30 PM after private clinic

issues.title: Communication Failures
issues.description: Significant communication gaps hampering effective operations and emergency responses.
details: Landline frequently disconnected due to non-payment
No WhatsApp helpline despite requests
No publicly visible contact information for complaints
Limited digital communication channels (no website or official social media)
Poor internal communication between departments

issues.title: Operational Inefficiencies
issues.description: Systemic operational inefficiencies preventing effective animal care and facility management.
details: Delayed implementation of approved plans from 2024 AGM
Bottlenecks in procurement processes
No formal complaint redressal system
Inadequate documentation of veterinary visits and treatments
Lack of standard operating procedures
Absence of proper administrative oversight for financial transactions

issues.title: Facility Structure Problems
issues.description: Significant structural issues compromising animal welfare and staff functionality.
details: Leaking walls allowing water ingress during rain
Broken sheds exposing animals to extreme weather
Deteriorated flooring in animal housing areas
Inadequate drainage systems causing hygiene issues
Security vulnerabilities including broken gates
Poor insulation making temperature control difficult

issues.title: Equipment Shortages
issues.description: Critical equipment shortages impacting animal care and emergency response capabilities.
details: Non-functional ambulance limiting emergency response
Insufficient heating equipment for winter months
Lack of proper medical equipment for basic treatments
Insufficient isolation equipment for disease control
Missing or broken animal handling tools

issues.title: Inadequate Animal Housing
issues.description: Animal housing facilities that fall below acceptable standards for proper care.
details: Cages lacking proper locks, posing safety risks
Insufficient isolation areas for contagious cases
Inadequate bedding especially during winter
Delayed procurement of bori/tirpal for animal protection
Poor segregation of animals based on health status, age, or temperament

issues.title: Administrative Infrastructure Deficiencies
issues.description: Severely lacking administrative infrastructure hampering efficient operations.
details: No computers for efficient record-keeping
Absence of digital database for animal records
Limited office equipment for day-to-day operations
No proper meeting space for staff and volunteer coordination
Insufficient storage for supplies and medications
No functioning security cameras despite approval
